source_sentence: 佛說聖寶藏神儀軌經卷下
translation: Foshuo shengbaozang shenyi gui jing rolled up

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻臚少卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra of the Buddha, Tathāgata, and Young Secretary of the Court

source_sentence: 傳教大師臣法天奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial order of the Minister Fetian, the Master of the Transmission of the Teachings

source_sentence: 復次曼拏羅內所用供獻之物。
translation: "Furthermore, the offerings used in the maṇḍala should be made in twenty pieces.
Twenty pieces should be made available.
Make offerings at three times each day.
The offering is made at the time of the hour.
They can't be used again at noon or 5:00 p.m.
They must be replaced with new ones.
If the person reciting it is unable to do so.
He's allowed to accept a price and directly redeem it.

source_sentence: 於第二時第三時再將供獻。
translation: At the second and third times, he offers it again.
This is true for all three times of the day.
He waits until he attains the altar worship.
On the day he accomplishes what he's seeking.
He quickly pays the full price for the previous offering.
When he makes the offering, he then makes the banner seal and recites the banner chant.
He then sets the seal for the banner and recites the true words of the banner.

source_sentence: 囉怛曩(二合)婆捺囉(二合)曩帝覩瑟也(二合)迦羅娑特嚩(二合)惹必里(二合)焰特嚩(二合)惹布惹迦娑嚩(二合引)賀復說衣物儀則。
translation: "Rātanan (sextuplets), padara (sextuplets), anthroposat (sextuplets), karasatha (sextuplets), japiri (sextuplets), japojagasatha (sextuplets), and furthermore, he explains the clothing code.

source_sentence: 以無蟲匹帛造白衣二對。
translation: He makes two pairs of white robes made of wormless silk.

source_sentence: 於衣上畫金彩莊嚴塔相。
translation: On the garments, he painted a gold-colored ornamented stūpa.
He said, "Now, I'll present the robes.

source_sentence: 即以兩手大指各捻頭指屈如環。
translation: He then takes the big fingers of each hand and twists the head finger to bend it like a ring.
He hooks the two rings together.
He spreads his other fingers apart and makes the clothing sign.
He then recites the true words for clothing seven times.
The true chant is.

source_sentence: 囉怛曩(二合)婆捺囉(二合)曩帝地里地里摩賀(引)三母捺覽(二合)麼囉馱娑嚩(二合引)賀復說扇儀則。
translation: "Rātanan (sextuplets), vajra (sextuplets), anon, dṛṣi, dṛṣi, mahā (sextuplets), samudrān (sextuplets), mālā, sādhāra (sextuplets), and furthermore, he explains the fan etiquette.
"A fan is made of worm-free silk.
The fan is white and fitted with a system.

source_sentence: 扇柄端直以金寶莊畫二柄。
translation: The end of the fan's handle is straight, and it's decorated with two handles of gold jewelry.
He says, "Now, I'll present the fan.

source_sentence: 即以左手屈小指於掌內。
translation: He then bends his little finger inside his palm with his left hand.
He shakes his arm and hand to make the fan sign.

source_sentence: 復誦扇真言七遍真言曰。
translation: He then recites the Fan Mantra seven times, saying.

source_sentence: 囉怛曩(二合)婆捺囉(二合)曩帝吠(引)覽婆嚩(引)喻馱(引)囉迦迦羅娑嚩(二合)賀復說拂儀則。
translation: "Rātanān (partially) vajra (partially) anon ti vai (partially) rambutan (partially) yudhā (partially) rākakara svāhas (partially) he further explains the ritual for whipping.
He makes a white whisk and decorates the handle of the whisk according to the rules.
He blesses it seven times with the true words of the whisk.

source_sentence: 然後於東北方安置曩婆夜叉王。
translation: Then, he placed the king of the night-sharks in the northeast.
To the north, he placed Vaiśravaṇa.
To the northwest, he placed Mahānāma.

source_sentence: 次安阿嚕尼所(二合)大力夜叉王。
translation: Next, he placed Alunisho (binary), the king of the powerful yakṣas.

source_sentence: 次安鉢捺摩護努護努迦。
translation: Next, he places Padmahoga-nubha-nuga.

source_sentence: 及酥細拏贊捺嚩昝婆句謨吒迦囉訖哆[口*爾]麼摩護捺囉。
translation: He then installed Pramāṇḍa-candana-vajra-mātṛkāra-ketu[k*er]mahoraga-nāga.
Next, he installed the night-crawler Maiden of Vaibhrajo.
This is the most distinguished of the yakṣa women.

source_sentence: 次安尾布覽　左　贊捺隣(二合引)輸摩呬摩呬誐挽(引)　左　酥路(引)左曩(引)　左　鉢納摩(二合)娑囉(引)　酥部嚕(二合)嚩尾　左　夜叉尼　摩賀(引)麼曳　酥枳細　左　嚩曩麼(引)羅(引)　左　必里(二合引)濕嚩(二合)梨　捺嚕(二合)摩麼黎迦　左　薩里嚩(二合)迦(引)摩頗羅鉢羅(二合)那(引)　及摩努(引)惹嚩(引)迦摩嚕閉　酥嚕(二合)哆嚩(引)吉也(二合)　酥[木*奈]里舍(二合)儞　摩護(引)誐囉(二合引)　唧(引)帝尾契也(二合)哆(引)等二十。
translation: 次安尾布覽　左　贊捺隣(二合引)輸摩呬摩呬誐挽(引)　左　酥路(引)左曩(引)　左　鉢納摩(二合)娑囉(引)　酥部嚕(二合)嚩尾　左　夜叉尼　摩賀(引)麼曳　酥枳細　左　嚩曩麼(引)羅(引)　左　必里(二合引)濕嚩(二合)梨　捺嚕(二合)摩麼黎迦　左　薩里嚩(二合)迦(引)摩頗羅鉢羅(二合)那(引)　及摩努(引)惹嚩(引)迦摩嚕閉　酥嚕(二合)哆嚩(引)吉也(二合)　酥[木*奈]里舍(二合)儞　摩護(引)誐囉(二合引)　唧(引)帝尾契也(二合)哆(引)等二十。

source_sentence: 或一百依次第安置於外方位。
translation: Perhaps a hundred of them are placed in sequential order in the outer directions.
Indra and other worthy sages are placed in front of them.

source_sentence: 作金剛網輪槍杖螺羂索幢三股叉。
translation: He makes a vajra-web wheel, a pistol, a staff, a conch, a rope-banner, and a three-pronged folding spear.

source_sentence: 及於東門安戟金剛焰等。
translation: At the east gate, he places a halberd, a vajra flame, and so forth.
These could be hundreds of things and more.
He used the marathi flower and the morika flower.
Wrapping it in five-colored powder.
He offers a scented offering and burns a subdued incense.

source_sentence: 誦心真言請召寶藏神及諸賢聖。
translation: Reciting the true words of the heart, he summons the treasured gods and the noble ones.
Reciting the original recitation, he summons the goddess Yakṣa.

source_sentence: 次獻花鬘摩羅帝花殊妙蓮花。
translation: Next, he offers a flower garland made of the marvelous lotus flower, the marvelous lotus flower, and the blue lotus flower.
Uppala flowers, Kananma flowers, and Kruvva flowers.
Kulluva flowers and Kishuka flowers.
All the good and noble people are offered in order.

source_sentence: 以紫礦安悉香龍腦香白檀香同作護摩。
translation: He used the scent of violet ore, a scent of sage, the scent of dragon brain, and the scent of white sandalwood to guard and moisten them together.
In front of the Bhadrapāla good sages, he placed various flowers and made offerings to them.

source_sentence: 置種種花種種供養之物。
translation: They place various flowers and offerings of various kinds.
Perhaps they hear a great evil sound and are destroyed.
This is an auspicious sign that mustn't cause fear.
He'll surely achieve what he seeks.
They'll attain the treasured store god and great wealth and prosperity.
This is the manual for the maṇḍala.
And the true words that are recited.

source_sentence: 唵(引)惹敢(二合)婆羅惹隣(引)捺羅(二合引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀　阿地鉢帝摩賀(引)夜叉囉(引)惹地摩呬(引)擔努(引)夜叉鉢囉(二合)冒(引)捺夜夜叉娑(引)尾怛里(二合引)唵(引)夜乞叉(二合)娑嚩(二合引)賀次心真言。
translation: "Om (citation) Jagang (binary) Bālājara (citation) Nārāyaṇa (binary) Sāgara (binary) He (citation) Atipati Mahā (citation) Yakṣa Rā (citation) Jagdi Mahor (citation) Tannu (citation) Yakṣa Prā (binary) Bold (citation) Nāyaṇa Sā (citation) Vetanari (binary) Om (citation) Yakṣa (binary) Sāgara (binary) He (binary) The next mental verbal.

source_sentence: 阿南哆鉢捺摩(二合引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀　夜乞叉(二合)尾儞也(二合引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀次蓮華藏真言。
translation: Anandopadma (cited in the Sanskrit text), svāhva (cited in the Sanskrit text), yakṣa (cited in the Sanskrit text), and svāhva (cited in the Sanskrit text).

source_sentence: 阿喃哆商佉(引)野娑嚩(二合)賀次螺藏真言。
translation: "Aṇḍa-saṃkha(citation needed) sāvarṇa(dichotomy) he says, 'The next conch-store verbal.'

source_sentence: 能令一切天龍夜叉乾闥婆阿脩羅迦樓羅緊那羅摩睺羅伽必里哆毘舍左人非人等恭敬讚歎皆大歡喜。
translation: They cause all gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, assuras, kiṃnaras, mahoraga, pṛthivīs, and humans and nonhumans to respect, praise, and greatly rejoice.

source_sentence: 又此真言利益一切眾生如如意寶如彼賢瓶如彼劫樹。
translation: This true teaching benefits all sentient beings like the wish-granting jewel, like that good vase, and like that eon tree.
Whatever they seek, they'll attain it.

source_sentence: 我今說此真言之法令彼持誦。
translation: Now, I'll explain this true teaching and order them to recite it.

source_sentence: 若彼不種善根眾生暫聞此法。
translation: If a sentient being who doesn't cultivate good roots hears this teaching for a while.

source_sentence: 彼人永不墮於惡趣之難。
translation: They'll never fall into the difficulty of a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 若有種善根者眾生之類。
translation: If there are people with good roots, that's a class of sentient beings.
They enjoy hearing, writing, accepting, maintaining, and reciting it.

source_sentence: 所得功德如佛如來功德無異。
translation: The merit attained is like that of a Buddha or Tathāgata, without distinction in terms of virtue.
Suppose someone accepts and upholds the true words of the mind.
That person will enter abhivartika.

source_sentence: 不久當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Soon, he'll achieve supreme, perfect enlightenment.
He'll be permanently freed from bad destinies.

source_sentence: 是人不貧不老無病無苦。
translation: That person won't be poor or old, has no illness, and is free from suffering.
He'll attain the consummation of various things.

source_sentence: 復得一切有情愛樂尊重恭敬供養。
translation: They'll also gain the affection, respect, deference, and offerings of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我今略說持此真言所獲功德。
translation: Now, I'll briefly explain the merits gained by holding to this true teaching.

source_sentence: 假使一切賢聖及天龍夜叉乾闥婆阿脩羅迦樓羅緊那羅等。
translation: 假使一切賢聖及天龍夜叉乾闥婆阿脩羅迦樓羅緊那羅等。
They wouldn't be able to know the amount of merit gained from this.
They couldn't explain it in detail.

source_sentence: 如是我等及彼諸佛如來應供正等正覺。
translation: Thus, we and the buddhas and tathāgatas are worthy of offerings and perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 說此真言功德亦不能盡。
translation: The virtue of speaking this truth can't be exhausted either.

source_sentence: 何況菩薩摩訶薩聲聞辟支佛及諸天人。
translation: How could it be possible for bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, śrāvakas, solitary buddhas, and gods to know the amount of merit of this teaching and then explain it?

source_sentence: 知此功德之量而說盡耶。
translation: How could they know the amount of merit of this teaching and say it's exhausted?

source_sentence: 如來一切智智功德無邊。
translation: The Tathāgata's omniscience and cognition have limitless merit.

source_sentence: 此大力寶藏神所有功德。
translation: The attributes of this mighty treasure treasury spirit are likewise.
It's likewise.

source_sentence: 此真言王一切如來真實之心。
translation: This is the true mind of the Tathāgata, the king of true speech.
He's the ruler of the whole world.
It's the one who saves the bad thoughts of sentient beings.
It's the one who tames the suffering and distress of sentient beings.
And it's capable of producing all kinds of wisdom.
If you seek the treasured store deity, you must draw an image of the deity to the right of the Tathāgata.
You should draw a picture of the Tathāgata's image to the right of him.

source_sentence: 白色手執拂子儀相圓滿。
translation: He's holding a whisk in his white hand and has a well-rounded demeanor.

source_sentence: 神像右邊畫金剛手菩薩。
translation: To the right of the image, he'll paint the Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva.
It's the color of a blue upādhyāna flower.
He's adorned with genuine pearls and has his mannerisms perfectly proportioned.

source_sentence: 菩薩前畫夜叉大悲寶賢子。
translation: In front of the bodhisattva is painted a night flying creature, the greatly compassionate Jeweled Son.
His body is the color of clear water and his features are perfectly proportioned.

source_sentence: 面帶善顏手執毘惹布羅果藏。
translation: His face is finely proportioned, and he's holding the fruit store of Vījiapura in his hand.

source_sentence: 著黃衣服大頭冠破損座垂左足。
translation: He's wearing yellow clothing, a large crown, and a broken seat that drapes his left foot.
Thus, he recites the name of the person from head to toe.
One by one, he observes the observances and mannerisms that are complete.
When he correctly observes the sūtra's one lakṣa, he arouses his mind to perform a separate act of making offerings.
He arouses his mind to separately contemplate the practice of making offerings.
He imagines the flowers that grow in the water.
The flowers on the land have a variety of nice fragrances.
All the treasures and exquisite clothing.

source_sentence: 及飲食燈鬘等而用供獻。
translation: They make offerings of food, drink, lamps, and jewelry.
He'll attain the fulfillment of all his vows.
After concentrating his mind in this way, he contemplates them.
he then recites it and says to himself.

source_sentence: 我依三寶儀則信受奉行。
translation: "I'll follow the ceremony for the Three Treasures and then accept and practice it with faith.

source_sentence: 然後依天龍儀則作護摩法。
translation: Then, according to the rituals of the gods and dragons, I'll perform the duty of guarding the Dharma.
He contemplates the treasured general Bhadrapāla.
He's holding a fire and putting it inside the fire-protecting censer.
The fire is burning in the censer of the Venerable Pūrṇa.
The Wealthy General prepares a purifying dharma.
The well-versed general spreads out a seat of auspicious grass.
This is accomplished by observing the Tathāgata's rules of conduct.
Next, he contemplates lighting a fire with the true words in his head.
He invokes it with the verbal form of the true verse.

source_sentence: 足真言作擁護求於成就。
translation: He plants his feet with the true words, "Embrace!" and seeks his accomplishment.
He then creates a guard to fill it.
He throws his hands three times.
He recites the true chant, saying.

source_sentence: 阿誐曩(二合)曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀即結吉祥等印。
translation: "Aga-nāga-rāja-sa-va-rāja!" That's the auspicious seal.
He makes a clasping motion with his second hand.
He places a worthy and a sage in the middle of it.
He contemplates and recites the true teaching.
In a moment's time, it's like a wind blowing a fire.

source_sentence: 觀想前所說乳汁作護摩一洛叉先獻八大明王作護摩一洛叉。
translation: He first presents the eight great luminous kings as guardian kings, observing the previously mentioned milk as guardian kings.
Next, he offered the great jeweled luminous kings.

source_sentence: 別作護摩一洛叉得大富貴。
translation: He makes a separate homa, a loxa, and attains great wealth and prosperity.
The second lakṣa will have prosperity for his children and grandchildren.
The third lakṣa has committed a great sin.
He'll also attain the accomplishment of the Dharma.
Such is the rule of concentrating your mind and continuing to work on it.
Next, he makes a guard of water.
He wraps a flower in water.

source_sentence: 以香水一千合作護摩獻寶藏神。
translation: Using 1,000 co-water protectors, he offers them to the treasure store deity.
It will always make him wealthy and happy.

source_sentence: 復作一千護摩得增長法。
translation: Again, he makes a thousand guardians to grow the Dharma.
He follows this ritual.
Contemplate as before the completion of the guard moat.
Offering three heaps of water to his family will give rise to growth.
Suppose he makes a guard of the five lakṣas.

source_sentence: 能令幀像隱身及令伏藏出現。
translation: It can cause a framed image to hide itself and cause a hidden treasure to appear.
Their enjoyment is inexhaustible, and they attain the highest happiness.
He also makes true words for feet and mouth, such as true words.
It causes all the things he seeks to accomplish.

source_sentence: 能禁怨家得過魔界永離深苦。
translation: He can restrain enemies and get past the demonic realm to escape deep suffering forever.

source_sentence: 行住坐臥所受福德與天帝釋等。
translation: When he walks, sits, and lies down, he receives the same merit as Indra and the gods.
This is the teaching.

source_sentence: 佛說聖寶藏神儀軌經卷下
translation: Foshuo shing baozang shenyi gui jing, vol. 2
